newsitem.title: GERMANY: TENNIS-STEFFI GRAF'S FATHER LEAVES COURT ON BAIL.
newsitem.headline: TENNIS-STEFFI GRAF'S FATHER LEAVES COURT ON BAIL.

text.p: Tennis star Steffi Graf's father was released on bail on Friday after a German court trying him on tax evasion charges ruled he no longer needed to remain in custody.
Graf slipped through the back door of the courtroom and left in a car after after paying five million marks ($3.3 million) in bail.
"I want to be at home," Graf told journalists. When asked if he had telephoned his daughter Steffi who is playing in a tournament in Philadelphia, Graf shook his head.
He was not allowed to say any more as the case is still continuing.

The 58-year-old had endured an anxious day waiting to hear whether a higher court in Karlsruhe would overturn the lower court's decision to release him from 15 months of custody. Prosecutors had objected to the decision.
It is possible Graf may be taken back into custody if the Karlsruhe court upholds other objections from the prosecution.
The Mannheim court said Graf would have to report to police twice a week and receive pyschotherapy. His mental health during his time in custody has been the subject of German newspaper speculation.
After the decision he was seen smiling and shaking hands with friends in the courtroom which was surrounded by police. He paid his bail with a cheque.
Graf is accused of evading 19 million marks ($13 million) of tax on his daughter's earnings between 1989 and 1993.
Steffi Graf has said she knew little about her financial affairs, entrusting them to her father from the start of a career which has taken her to the number one spot in women's tennis.
